description.narrative: Bridging funds to UNDP PAJUST until March 31, 2015 while appraisal of the second phase of the programme is prepared. The intervention concerns a programme, which integrates the four principles of transitional justice: truth, justice, reparation and non-recurrence.

UNDP har ansökt om medel från Sverige för finansiering av "Bridging Funds/Initiation Plan PAJUST II under januari till mars 2015 med USD 1 129 000. Syftet med insatsen är överbryggande finansiering mellan PAJUST I 2010-2014 och PAJUST II som planeras att påbörjas 1 april 2015. Medlen kommer att användas för att stödja de partners som är i störst behov av finansiering under denna period, samt att förbereda för den andra fasen av PAJUST.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The contribution concerns bridging funds to PAJUST January - March 2015, during assessment and negotations concerning the new phase of PAJUST April 2015 - December 2018. During this bridging period, PAJUST worked to consolidate results from the first phase and with start up of the second phase 2015-2018. Key successes of the program 2010-2014: PAJUST worked with six state institutions and more than 30 civil society organizations within the framework of the Components Truth, Justice, Reparation and Non-recurrence. Truth: More than 17 million documents in the National Historical Police Archive organized, digitalized and accessible for the public. Justice: Substantial progress in 20 paradigmatic cases of human rights violations, supporting 2 626 victims (1534 women and 1092 men), including 106 women in cases of sexual violence during the internal armed conflict. 10 convictions in cases including forced disappearances, massacres and genocide. Reparation: More than 550 exhumations in clandestine cementeries at national level, the establishment of a genetic bank in accordance with international standards, which has contributed to the identification of approximately 2000 victims for their inhumations by their families. More than 20 000 families of victims have received legal and psycho-social support in the process of search for assassinated or disasppeared family members. Non-recurrence: Implementation of mechanisms for training of state officials, monitoring and resolution of conflicts at province level, follow up of international obligations in human rights in coordination with more than 50 state units. PAJUST worked with six state institutions and more than 30 civil society organizations For more information about results see the first phase of PAJUST 2010-2014, Sida contribution ID 52080017, and the second phase of PAJUST 2015-2018 Sida contribution ID 55200000.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
